item.title: Hakuoki SSL: Sweet School Life for Switch launches February 12, 2026 in the west
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

English opening movie and screenshots released.

eastasiasoft will release the Switch version of otome visual novel Hakuoki SSL: Sweet School Life in English on February 12, 2026, the publisher announced. Pre-orders for physical editions are still available via Play-Asia.

Hakuoki SSL: Sweet School Life first launched for PS Vita on March 27, 2014 in Japan, followed by Switch on June 15, 2023.

Here is an overview of the game, via eastasiasoft:

About

The long-running Hakuoki otome visual novel series enters a new era! Hakuoki SSL: Sweet School Life puts a modern spin on the Edo period romance of the main series, instead casting heroine Chizuru and the handsome warriors of the Shinsengumi as students and teachers living in modern Japan. School life antics ensue as these beloved characters hold a school festival, stress over midterms, get into watergun fights and more!

Experience a fun slice-of-life story through unlockable event scenes, engaging dialogue and beautifully illustrated character portraits, all localized in English for the first time. Explore unique endings with each character and enjoy mini-games that make this standalone entry extra special!

Key Features

  • Take the role of Chizuru as she’s surrounded by familiar faces in a new modern setting!
  • Engage in fun mini-games with the handsome warriors of the Shinsengumi.
  • Make key choices and discover unique endings with each possible love interest!
  • Enjoy voiceovers in Japanese and newly localized text in English.
  • Navigate scenarios with ease using a variety of user interface controls and preferences!

item.title: Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves DLC character Joe Higashi debut trailer, screenshots
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Due out this fall.

SNK has released the debut trailer and screenshots for Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves downloadable content character Joe Higashi, who is due out this fall.

Get the latest details below.

Joe Higashi (voiced by Kevin Andrew Rivera in English, Kouzou Mito in Japanese)

Famed Muay Thai fighter with stiff kicks that can shatter steel. No other kickboxer can lay a finger, elbow, or knee on Joe Higashi, so the champ winds up tackling a different beast: the silver screen! His biopic documentary, The Legend of Joe (directed by none other than Cheng Sinzan), is already shooting around South Town; Joe even envisions a bit part for star pupil Preecha, whose recent tournament triumphs have done her master proud.

New Stories in Arcade Mode and Episodes of South Town

  • Arcade Mode – Joe and legacy character Cheng Sinzan set out to film a major motion picture, The Legend of Joe, based on the Muay Thai master’s eventful life.
  • Episodes of South Town – Joe’s single-player RPG adventure sees him romp through the city while reminiscing about how he met star pupil Preecha.

Play Joe at Tokyo Game Show 2025

The Muay Thai legend Joe Higashi will make his first playable appearance at Tokyo Game Show 2025. Those interested in an early demo can stop by the Samsung SSD booth, before Joe officially arrives for all players this Fall.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.
